intro: Exallage lineata, commonly known as the lined flax. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its distinctive linear leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period typically occurs in summer, adding vibrant color to garden landscapes.
